name: AlcoholBriefInterventionAndCounseling
title: Alcohol Brief Intervention and Counseling
description: This value set has been tested at one clinical pilot environment. Use with caution. (Reviewed for code updates 4/2022)
purpose: (Clinical Focus: Alcohol brief intervention and counseling services that may be provided to an individual that screens "positive" for excessive alcohol intake (i.e., unhealthy alcohol intake, risky alcohol use)),(Data Element Scope: Alcohol brief intervention and counseling  services that may be provided to an individual that screens "positive" for excessive alcohol intake (i.e., unhealthy alcohol intake, risky alcohol use).),(Inclusion Criteria: HCPCS codes that represent alcohol brief intervention and counseling services.),(Exclusion Criteria: Medications used to treat excessive alcohol intake (e.g, alcohol use disorder). Behavioral counseling services that do not explicitly mention alcohol.)

concept.display: Patient counseled about risks of alcohol use (hep-c)
Patient counseled regarding psychosocial and pharmacologic treatment options for alcohol dependence (sud)
Alcohol and/or substance abuse screening and intervention, 15-30 minutes
Alcohol and/or substance abuse screening and intervention, greater than 30 minutes
Alcohol and/or substance (other than tobacco) abuse structured assessment (e.g., audit, dast), and brief intervention 15 to 30 minutes
Alcohol and/or substance (other than tobacco) abuse structured assessment (e.g., audit, dast), and intervention, greater than 30 minutes
Brief face-to-face behavioral counseling for alcohol misuse, 15 minutes
Patient identified as an unhealthy alcohol user when screened for unhealthy alcohol use using a systematic screening method and received brief counseling
Alcohol and/or drug services; group counseling by a clinician
Alcohol and/or drug services; case management
Alcohol and/or drug services; crisis intervention (outpatient)

Alcohol and/or drug services; medical/somatic (medical intervention in ambulatory setting)
Alcohol and/or drug intervention service (planned facilitation)
Alcohol and/or drug services, brief intervention, per 15 minutes
